description.para:
Get the first managed texture ID for iteration
min_rc
Minimum reference count filter
First managed texture ID with refCount >= min_rc

briefdescription.para: Get the next managed texture ID for iteration.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the previous texture
Minimum reference count filter

simplesect.para: Next managed texture ID after prev_id with refCount >= min_rc

briefdescription.para: Read-only access to the current texture quality level.

simplesect.para: This is READ-ONLY, do not modify this value

briefdescription.para: Read-only access to the current texture anisotropy.

simplesect.para: This is READ-ONLY, do not modify this value

briefdescription.para: Registers external D3D resource with the specified name as managed and returns the D3DRESID for it.

detaileddescription.para:
Specified resource becomes owned by the manager, no factory is assigned to it. RefCount is set to 1 and when it eventually reaches 0, the resource is automatically destroyed and the name is evicted. Use release_managed_res() or release_managed_res_verified() to del ref and finally destroy.
Resource name is case-insensitive and must be unique.
name
the name to register the resource under
res
the resource to register
the D3DRESID for the registered resource

briefdescription.para: Checks whether creation/release factory is set for D3DRESID.

detaileddescription.para:
E.g. for an ID that was acquired from register_managed_res(), it will return false.
id
the D3DRESID to check
true if a factory was specified for the D3DRESID

briefdescription.para: Gets the name for a managed resource by ID, or nullptr if ID is invalid.

parameterdescription.para: the D3DRESID to get the name for

simplesect.para: the name of the managed resource with ID id or nullptr

briefdescription.para: Gets managed resource ID by its name, or BAD_D3DRESID if name is invalid.

parameterdescription.para: the name of the resource to get the ID for

simplesect.para: the managed resource ID that corresponds to res_name or BAD_D3DRESID if the name is invalid

briefdescription.para: Gets the reference count for a managed resource by ID.

parameterdescription.para: the ID to get the reference count for

simplesect.para: the reference count for the D3DRESID resource or a negative value if the resource is missing

briefdescription.para: Enables or disables multithreading support for resource manager and preallocates internal structures to handle upto max_res_entry_count resource entries without reallocations.

detaileddescription.para:
enable_res_mgr_mt(false, -1) will disable multithreading support and shrink entries array to used size
enable
whether to enable multithreading support
max_res_entry_count
the maximum number of resource entries to preallocate or -1 to shrink to fit

briefdescription.para: Adds entry for managed texture name and returns TEXTUREID for it.

detaileddescription.para:
When entry for 'name' already exists, it just returns TEXTUREID. For new entry 'factory' is set as creator, for existing entry 'factory' must be nullptr.
Texture name is case-insensitive and must be unique.
name
Name that uniquely identifies the texture
factory
Custom texture creation mechanism, must be nullptr for existing textures
Managed ID of the texture

briefdescription.para: Adds or updates entry for managed array texture name, stores creation properties and returns TEXTUREID for it.

detaileddescription.para:
Array texture will be composed of slices with texture names tex_slice_nm.
Textures in slices must have the same format and size, and furthermore, some restrictions of DDSx flags apply.
name
Name that uniquely identifies the new array texture
tex_slice_nm
Array of texture names to use as slices
Managed ID of the texture

briefdescription.para: Updates an existing array texture entry with new slices.

simplesect.para: The number of slices must match the original array texture.
Simply calls add_managed_texture() under the hood, this function exists purely for readability purposes.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the array texture to update
Array of new texture names to use as slices

simplesect.para: Managed ID of the array texture that was updated

briefdescription.para: Checks all registered array textures and reloads those referencing specified slice.

parameterdescription.para: Name of changed texture that can be used as slice in some array texture

simplesect.para: Number of reloaded array textures (or 0 if no array texture reference that slice)

briefdescription.para: Schedules removal of the managed entry for the specified id and sets id to BAD_TEXTUREID (unconditionally, even if the operation fails or is deferred).

detaileddescription.para:
When refCount = 0, removal is performed immediately, otherwise it is deferred. Can be used to remove entries created with register_managed_tex(), add_managed_texture(), add_managed_array_texture()
id
ID of the texture to remove
true if the texture was removed immediately, false otherwise, including if the operation was invalid.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether contents of managed texture was loaded.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the texture to check
true to check for full quality, false for any quality

simplesect.para: true if the texture is loaded, false otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (dag::ConstSpan< TEXTUREID > id, bool fq_loaded=false, bool ignore_unref_tex=true)
memberdef.name: check_all_managed_textures_loaded

briefdescription.para: Checks whether contents of all managed textures in list was loaded, analogous to calling check_managed_texture_loaded() multiple times.

simplesect.para: Skips checks for textures with refcount=0 by default.

parameterdescription.para: List of texture IDs to check.
true to check for full quality, false for any quality
true to skip textures with refcount=0

simplesect.para: true if all textures (excluding those with refcount=0 if ignore_unref_tex is true) are loaded, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Replaces the texture for managed id id.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the texture to replace
New driver texture to use for this id
Custom texture creation mechanism

simplesect.para: true if the texture was replaced successfully, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Discards unused texture: unloads texture when refCount=0, does nothing otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the texture to discard

briefdescription.para: Iterate all managed textures and unload those with refCount=0.
Set current frame as 'last frame used' for texture.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the texture to mark
Quality level that was used on this frame

briefdescription.para: Request texture content load.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the texture to load

simplesect.para: true when texture already loaded, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Requests texture content load for a list of textures, the same as calling prefetch_managed_texture() multiple times.

parameterdescription.para: List of texture IDs to load

simplesect.para: true when all textures are already loaded

briefdescription.para: Requests texture content load for list of textures by TEXTAG.

parameterdescription.para: The tag to load textures for

simplesect.para: true when all textures with the tag are already loaded

memberdef.argsstring: (dag::ConstSpan< TEXTUREID > id, unsigned add_importance=1, int min_lev_for_dyn_decrease=16)
memberdef.name: mark_managed_textures_important

briefdescription.para: Marks list of textures as important (to force loading content upto requested quality level as soon as possible)

parameterdescription.para: List of texture IDs to mark
Additional importance to add to the textures
important textures with more levels min can be downgraded 1 mip when dyn decrease used

briefdescription.para: Resets streaming state of textures so that they can be reloaded respecting the global tex quality settings changes.
Sets the default texture factory to use for managed textures.
Gets the default texture factory.
Gets the symbolic texture factory which always produces nulls for texture creation.
Gets the stub texture factory which always produces stub 1x1 textures.
Init data and callbacks to support streaming.

detaileddescription.para:
Settings are taken from dgs_get_settings()->getBlockByName("texStreaming").
reload_jobmgr_id=-2 means auto creation of jobmanager, reload_jobmgr_id=-1 means no jobmanager
rload_jobmgr_id
Either -1 or -2, controls whether to create a job manager for texture streaming

briefdescription.para: Checks whether texture streaming is inited and active.

simplesect.para: true if texture streaming is active, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Checks whether texture streaming loads textures only when used.

simplesect.para: true if texture streaming is load-on-demand, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Dumps current memory usage (Sys/Gpu) state of texture streaming.
Checks whether the specified texture is split BQ/HQ with missing HQ part.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the texture to check

simplesect.para: true if the texture is missing HQ part, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Re-loads anisotropy config from settings.
Marks that a texture's anisotropy should not be changed automatically.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the texture to mark

briefdescription.para: Resets anisotropy for all textures whose name contains tex_name_filter as a substring.

parameterdescription.para: Substring filter to match texture names

briefdescription.para: Attempts to load the texture for usage on the current frame and simply checks for immediate success.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the texture to load and check
true to check for full quality, false for any quality

simplesect.para: true if the texture is loaded, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Attempts to load multiple textures for usage on the current frame and check for immediate success.

parameterdescription.para: List of texture IDs to load and check
true to check for full quality, false for any quality

simplesect.para: true if all textures are loaded, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Synchronously loads a list of textures, blocking the current thread until all textures are loaded.

parameterdescription.para: List of texture IDs to load
true to wait for full quality, false for any quality

briefdescription.para: Utility for iterating all managed textures.

detaileddescription.para:
Managed textures form a linked list, so for an arbitrary ID, this function returns the "next" ID in the list. Hence one is supposed to call this function in a loop until it returns BAD_TEXTUREID.
after_tid
ID of the texture to get the next texture for. Use BAD_TEXTUREID to start iteration.
min_ref_count
Minimum reference count filter
Some ID that follows after_tid and has refCount >= min_ref_count OR BAD_TEXTUREID if the iteration is done.

briefdescription.para: Access to the highest valid texture ID for storing properties of managed textures in arrays.

simplesect.para: Highest valid texture ID

briefdescription.para: Get generation of managed texture content, which changes during streaming.

parameterdescription.para: valid ID of texture

simplesect.para: Generation of streaming data

briefdescription.para: returns true when tid resembles texture ID and (optionally checked) contains valid value (non-BAD and has proper generation)
Get texture meta data.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the texture to get the meta data for

briefdescription.para: Get a sampler info structure from texture meta data.
Returns separate sampler for the texture ID.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the texture to get the sampler for

simplesect.para: Sampler handle for the texture. If no separate sampler is set, returns invalid handle
Returned sampler must not be destroyed
The function is not thread-safe, and the caller must ensure that there are no concurrent setters for this texture ID

briefdescription.para: Sets separate sampler for the texture ID.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the texture to set the sampler for
Sampler info for sampler to set

simplesect.para: true if the sampler was set successfully, false otherwise
Calling a function for the same texture ID is not thread-safe
Calling a function for different texture IDs is thread-safe

briefdescription.para: Sets the LOD bias for a batch of substring-bias pairs.

parameterdescription.para: A span of LODBiasRule objects containing substring and LOD bias pairs.
